required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Reactogenicity, Safety and Immunogenicity of Flu-M Inactivated Split Influenza Vaccine in Volunteers Aged 18-60 Years
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Reactogenicity, Safety and Immunogenicity of Flu-M Inactivated Split Influenza Vaccine in Volunteers Aged 18-60 Years

lead_sponsor.agency: St. Petersburg Research Institute of Vaccines and Sera

clinical_study.source: St. Petersburg Research Institute of Vaccines and Sera

brief_summary.textblock: Study of the Reactogenicity, Safety and Immunogenicity of Flu-M Inactivated Split Influenza Vaccine in Volunteers Aged 18-60 Years

detailed_description.textblock: All subjects will be followed up for 21 days post-randomization. The subjects will further be assessed at 2 days, 7 days, 21 days following the booster vaccination. Blood samples will be collected for reactogenicity and safety and immunogenicity assessments before injection and 21 days after vaccination.

primary_outcome.measure: Severity of reported local reactions and their relationship with the vaccination
Severity of reported system reactions and their relationship with the vaccination - during 7 days after the vaccination (the day of vaccination and 6 subsequent days)
Severity of local reactions reported by participants of the study and their relationship with the vaccination
Severity of system reactions reported by participants of the study and their relationship with the vaccination
The measurement physical data at each visit of the trial site by the volunteer

secondary_outcome.measure: The immunogenicity assessment of the vaccine was carried out by the seroconversion factor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be taken at screening, then up to 21 days post-vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: The immunogenicity assessment of the vaccine was carried out by Geometric mean titer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be taken at screening, then up to 21 days post-vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: The immunogenicity assessment of the vaccine was carried out by seroprotection levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be taken at screening, then up to 21 days post-vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: The immunogenicity assessment of the vaccine was carried out by seroconversion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be taken at screening, then up to 21 days post-vaccination

arm_group.description: 15 volunteers were treated with the Flu-M inactivated split influenza vaccine without a preservative
15 volunteers were treated with the Flu-M inactivated split influenza vaccine with a preservative
15 volunteers were treated with a placebo

facility.name: Perm State Medical University named after academician E.A. Wagner
